alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 19 at 6:21AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 915 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 615 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over leeward areas of Maui. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. The heaviest rain is falling between Kihei and Kipahulu. Additional heavy showers are expected throughout the morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kihei, Lahaina, Kula, Ulupalakua, Keokea, Olowalu, Nuu, Kipahulu, Maalaea and Kaupo. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 915 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. A Flood Watch is also in effect for Maui County until 6 PM HST this afternoon.
